solution_line_template: Since 1/{fraction_denominator} of her money is ${sweater_cost}, then Leila originally had ${sweater_cost} x {fraction_denominator} = $<<{sweater_cost}*{fraction_denominator}={original_money}>>{original_money}.
${original_money} - ${sweater_cost} = $<<{original_money}-{sweater_cost}={money_left_after_sweater}>>{money_left_after_sweater} was left after buying a sweater.
Since she is left with ${money_left_final}, Leila spent ${money_left_after_sweater} - ${money_left_final} = $<<{money_left_after_sweater}-{money_left_final}={jewelry_cost}>>{jewelry_cost} on jewelry.
Therefore, she spent ${jewelry_cost} - ${sweater_cost} = $<<{jewelry_cost}-{sweater_cost}={difference_in_spending}>>{difference_in_spending} more for jewelry than on a sweater.
